Articles.Content:
So, I was playing with the RSS and all the mods, that come with it. I was trying to make an moon mission and tested out the Service Module, when suddenly, THIS happened!

Note the orbital stats. Most of them show "Nan". Also, the surface velocity is wierd...

The SM slowly drifted away, leaving the CM onto it is own posission near the ground. And yes, I am sure, that I did not use hack gravity

Am I onto a new kind of Kraken? Or did I just experience something, that we already know?

Also, I find this kinda funny .

Something like this started happening to me. Large ships would seem to forget they were orbiting anything and show velocity of zero. Then after a few seconds explode sending pieces clear out of the solar system. I could fix the game by restarting it, but it got worse and worse like it something was wrong with my save file, I haven't played again since cuz the whole thing is bugged now and I cant launch anything without it exploding after a minute.
Yeah, that is a known thing. But I didn't have any explosions. The CM just stayed floating above the ground and SM just floated away really slowly. Also, I could still controll the SM.
We told Jeb to stop dividing by zero.

We told Jeb to stop dividing by zero.

Thanks, today I will check, if he stopped. If he did not, should I punish him somehow? Maybe leave him in the CM, while Bob and Bill go for the landing?
Soooo...now it starts to happen with landers as well.
A new kraken species?! What name should it have XD

Pretty sure it is the same old Kraken just up to new tricks. OP, I would definitely try to repeat that issue with mods off, at least as well as you can if you also used modded parts. It would be handy for finding out if the Kraken might be playing with your mods, or it is just sticking to stock parts.

Looks like an addon kraken to me

Movenating!

Looks like an addon kraken to me

Movenating!

Alrighty, thank you. And yes, it seems to be a thing with the Realism Overhaul resized parts. When I took out R.O from the Gamedata folder, this glitch stopped existing.

This is, what the debug menu shows me

So it really was Jeb dividing by zero...

damn you, jeb
So...what should I do next? Ask from the R.O thread? Would the output log be any good?
Might be useful to see the logs yeah, and also post this in the R.O thread in case it can be fixed

I've decided KSP has the best debug messages ever.

problem!

NaN, NaN, NaN?
I think it is TweakableEverything, Ive had that happen to me before.
Yeah, it is TweakableEverything. coldbalde2000, were you able to fix that problem? Or do I just have to uninstall T.E?
